column3: This course builds on the skills and concepts learned in our previous computer science courses.  The topics challenge students to explore how computing and technology can impact the world, with a unique focus on creative problem solving and real-world applications.

column2: understand and be able to use a variety of data types, control structures, and algorithmic problem-solving techniques in their programming
design, document, implement and test solutions to programming problems
express creativity using coding and technology in a variety of contexts
identify and repair coding errors in a program
effectively communicate programming solutions to others
work collaboratively to write modular code on larger projects
